name: Milk Powder
description:
Similac 3

Client takes care of her 1-year-old child alone and is also similac 3expecting another baby in May 2025. Her husband is currently in jail. Client left her job last year to care for her child full-time and is now unable to find work due to her second pregnancy. With no income and increasing expenses, she is facing significant financial difficulties. Hence, Client hopes to receive donations for milk and diapers to meet her child's basic needs while she finds an alternative long-term support.

name: laptop
description:
Client suffered a vertigo attack in 2022 and has been feeling nauseous and having frequent dizzy spells since then. Client has been deterred from securing gainful, full-time employment in view of her poor health status as she is unable to stand for long hours. Despite her challenges, client has consistently demonstrated resilience and determination to achieve self-sufficiency, as evident in her active efforts to take on ad-hoc employment opportunities despite her poor 
health status. Client hopes to have a laptop to allow her to explore upskilling or engage in other types of employment which may be more suited for her health condition (i.e. administrative/accounting-related work).

contact.org: Viriya Community Services - Whispering Hearts Family Service Centre
contact.name: Lim Dong Qin

name: Sofa
description:
Client is 59and  wheelchair bound with multiple issues and on diapers. She is living with her son aged 17 who is awaiting NS enlistement.

They are living in 2 room rental flat with minimal support and have financial constraint in managing day to day expenses.

Client is dependent on her son to change her diapers who returns home late and tends to soil the sofa on such occasions.
Her current sofa is soiled and is in bad condition.

name: Laptop
description:
Client is a 67 years old senior who lives alone, and was forced to retire as a driver, after he got into an accident 3 years ago. 

Senior is presently not receiving any financial assistance, and gets by with quarterly silver support scheme payouts. 

Senior shared that he always wanted a laptop but could not afford it. He wish to learn how to check emails, as well as to watch his YouTube videos on a bigger screen.
